claim: Locally funded charter schools outnumber all other funding types in Santa Clara County; the percentage ratio is approximately 120%.
extra_info: Ratio in percentage = (count(locally funded schools in Santa Clara) / count(all funding type schools in Santa Clara) * 100%
reasoning: In Santa Clara County, locally funded charter schools number 20, while directly funded schools number 60. Locally funded schools do NOT outnumber other funding types. The percentage ratio is (20/80)*100 = 25%, not approximately 120% as claimed.

content.text: I'll start by exploring the database schema to understand the relevant tables and columns.

input.description: List all tables in the database
Get full schema of the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE satscores
(
    cds         TEXT not null
        primary key,
    rtype       TEXT  not null,
    sname       TEXT null,
    dname       TEXT null,
    cname       TEXT null,
    enroll12    INTEGER         not null,
    NumTstTakr  INTEGER          not null,
    AvgScrRead  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrMath  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrWrite INTEGER          null,
    NumGE1500   INTEGER          null,
--     PctGE1500   double      null,
        foreign key (cds) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE schools
(
    CDSCode     TEXT not null
        primary key,
    NCESDist    TEXT  null,
    NCESSchool  TEXT  null,
    StatusType  TEXT  not null,
    County      TEXT not null,
    District    TEXT not null,
    School      TEXT null,
    Street      TEXT null,
    StreetAbr   TEXT null,
    City        TEXT null,
    Zip         TEXT null,
    State       TEXT  null,
    MailStreet  TEXT null,
    MailStrAbr  TEXT null,
    MailCity    TEXT null,
    MailZip     TEXT null,
    MailState   TEXT  null,
    Phone       TEXT null,
    Ext         TEXT  null,
    Website     TEXT null,
    OpenDate    DATE        null,
    ClosedDate  DATE        null,
    Charter     INTEGER    null,
    CharterNum  TEXT  null,
    FundingType TEXT null,
    DOC         TEXT  not null,
    DOCType     TEXT not null,
    SOC         TEXT  null,
    SOCType     TEXT null,
    EdOpsCode   TEXT  null,
    EdOpsName   TEXT null,
    EILCode     TEXT  null,
    EILName     TEXT null,
    GSoffered   TEXT null,
    GSserved    TEXT  null,
    Virtual     TEXT  null,
    Magnet      INTEGER   null,
    Latitude    REAL      null,
    Longitude   REAL      null,
    AdmFName1   TEXT null,
    AdmLName1   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail1   TEXT null,
    AdmFName2   TEXT null,
    AdmLName2   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail2   TEXT null,
    AdmFName3   TEXT  null,
    AdmLName3   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail3   TEXT null,
    LastUpdate  DATE        not null
);

content.text: I can see the `schools` table has `FundingType` and `County` columns. Let me now query to check the claim.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT FundingType, COUNT(*) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND FundingType IS NOT NULL GROUP BY FundingType;"
input.description: Count schools by funding type in Santa Clara County

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND FundingType = 'Locally funded';"
input.description: Count locally funded schools in Santa Clara

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND FundingType IS NOT NULL;"
input.description: Count all schools with a funding type in Santa Clara

content.text:
Now let me verify the claim's assertions:

1. **"Locally funded charter schools outnumber all other funding types"**: In Santa Clara County, there are 20 locally funded schools and 60 directly funded schools. Locally funded schools do **NOT** outnumber other funding types — they are actually far fewer (20 vs 60).

2. **"The percentage ratio is approximately 120%"**: Using the hint formula: (count locally funded / count all funding type schools) * 100 = (20 / 80) * 100 = **25%**, not 120%.

Both assertions in the claim are wrong according to the data.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "In Santa Clara County, locally funded charter schools number 20, while directly funded schools number 60. Locally funded schools do NOT outnumber other funding types. The percentage ratio is (20/80)*100 = 25%, not approximately 120% as claimed."}
```
